1:
Then Job replied and said this:
\q1
3:
I wish that I knew where I could meet with him
\q2 so that I could go to the place where he lives.
\q1
5:
Then I would find out and understand what he would reply to me.
\q1
6:
Would he use his great power to argue with me?
\q2 No, he would listen to me carefully.
\q1
7:
I am an honest man, so I would be able to discuss things with him fairly,
\q2 and then he would declare that I am innocent, and he would not trouble me again.
\b
\q1
9:
I have gone north and I have gone south,
\q2 but I have not seen him anywhere for he keeps himself from me.
\q1
12:
I have always obeyed what he commanded;
\q2 I have hidden away in my inner being the words that he has spoken.
\b
\q1
13:
He never changes. There is no one who can stop him from doing what he desires.
\q2 Whatever he wants to do, he does.
\q1
14:
He will finish doing the things that he has planned for me,
\q2 and I am sure that he has thought about doing many things for me.
\q1
16:
Almighty God has made me very afraid.
\q1
17:
It is as though there were only thick darkness in front of me,
\q2 but it is God who destroys me, not the darkness."
